intro: Brachypodium pinnatum subvar. villosum, commonly known as hairy false brome, is a perennial grass native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 stems and narrow, grass-like leaves covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brownish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
